summary: Very Stealthy follower that sometimes uses a bow but usually fights with his claws.
descriptionHtml:
Do' Bassa, your Khajiit Nightingale follower!  Ok, he's not really a Nightingale.  He killed a Nightingale and thought the armor looked cool so now he's wearing it.  Except for the  helmet, he threw that away after exclaiming "This headgear is crushing my ears."

I like stealthy punch cats and punch lizards as followers but sometimes a follower with some archery skill is handy.  Do'Bassa is just as sneaky as Do'Shaar and punches almost as hard as Jeek. 

Build up your own sneak skills and you'll find he's extremely efficient at eliminating any lone adversary.   Work your way behind someone then order Do'Bassa to attack.  If he can he'll quietly dispatch his target with a choke hold without raising any alarms.  Do'Bassa will use his bow if the enemy is far away. 

Do'Bassa uses some game setting adjustments, his own combat style and some kill move tweaks.  Other mods that alter these settings may cause a conflict.   Tested OK with Dawnguard,  Dragonborn, EFF and a long list of other mods.  Do'Bassa is a modified version of Do'Shaar whispering fangs and uses elements from Jeek Half-Dragon.  He may not play nicely with these mods.  Seems OK with Jeek haven't tested him with Do'Shaar.

Do'Bassa requires nothing more than Skyrim with the official update.  Images show Do'Bassa with these mods (I think)  Muscular Khajiit Textures http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim /mods/40043/  and  Bulky Skeleton for Beast Race http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61132/. 

To eliminate the arrow quiver on his back when invisible use the Auto Unequip Ammo mod http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10753/ with follower package box checked.

You'll find Do'Bassa in Bronze Water Cavern.

Thank you to Ominousvoice who posted the WeaponPushEffect script for knockback without making some targets immortal.  It's much cleaner than the workaround I was using.  I make no claims on anything in this mod.  Use abuse, modify and enjoy, or not, as you see fit.
author: GrumpyMule
